start.message:
Hello! 
I am **Permanager**, your assistant for flexible access rights management in Telegram channels and Discord servers.
My goal is to simplify the lives of administrators by providing convenient tools for setting up rights to moderation teams without having to rely on the standard Telegram or Discord roles.

 With my help , you can:
✅ Assign rights to teams in a new way, not limited to standard roles.
 Create custom rights groups for users.
 Simplify moderation management by making it as transparent and convenient as possible.

🎉 Let's get started!
📋 **Basic commands**:

`/config` — Configure the global parameters of the bot on the server.
`/reminder` — Managing reminders
`/cancel` — Canceling the execution of the current command
`/help` — Show a list of all available commands and their description.

If you have any questions, just use /help.
Let's start simplifying your work together! 🚀

help.commandHelp: 📌 _ Write /help [command name] to get more information_

start.againSection: Try again. Enter section (dashboard, user, group)

dashboard.start:
*Control Panel*:

- Setting up standard access rights
*Standard access rights that will be granted to new moderators or a group*

-Setting up standard restrictions
*Standard restrictions that will be issued to new moderators or a group*

- Setting up moderation teams
*Enable or disable moderation commands. IMPORTANT*: this section does not *hide* commands, but does not give access to work with them

defaultRightAccess.title: **Setting up standard access rights**
defaultRightAccess.description:
`🟢 | Access to the command is available`
`🔴 | There is no access to the command`

*Set up access rights correctly*. These permissions will be granted to newly added moderators who are not in the group, and will also be granted to newly created groups:

defaultLimits.title: *Setting standard limits*
defaultLimits.description: *Set up the restrictions correctly*. These restrictions will be set for newly added moderators who are not in the group, and they will also be issued to newly created groups:
defaultLimits.restrictions:
Commands restrictions:

- Kick:
	- Amount of uses: %USES_COUNT%
	- During: %PERIOD_TIMESTAMP%

- Ban:
	- Amount of uses: %USES_COUNT%
	- During: %PERIOD_TIMESTAMP%

- Unban:
	- Amount of uses: %USES_COUNT%
	- During: %PERIOD_TIMESTAMP%

- Mute:
	- Amount of uses: %USES_COUNT%
	- During: %PERIOD_TIMESTAMP%

- Unmute:
	- Amount of uses: %USES_COUNT%
	- During: %PERIOD_TIMESTAMP%

- Warn:
	- Amount of uses: %USES_COUNT%
	- During: %PERIOD_TIMESTAMP%

- Remwarn:
	- Amount of uses: %USES_COUNT%
	- During: %PERIOD_TIMESTAMP%

- Resetwarm:
	- Amount of uses: %USES_COUNT%
	- During: %PERIOD_TIMESTAMP%

- Clear:
	- Amount of uses: %USES_COUNT%
	- During: %PERIOD_TIMESTAMP%

- Temprole:
	- Amount of uses: %USES_COUNT%
	- During: %PERIOD_TIMESTAMP%

moderationCommands.title: *Setting up moderation commands*
moderationCommands.description: *Set up the restrictions correctly*. These restrictions do not hide the commands, but make them inaccessible to all users and moderators:

language.complete: The language has been successfully switched

timezone.complete: The time zone has been successfully set

start.action: Specify one of the actions (Actions: create, edit, remove, list)
start.againAction: There is no such action. Try again (Actions: create, edit, remove, list)

create.date: Specify the date on which you want to send the reminder (Format: dd.mm.yyyy hh:mm or hh:mm)
create.content: Specify the contents of the reminder

error.invalidDate: Incorrect time format (Format: dd.mm.yyyy hh:mm or hh:mm). For example, on 3.12.2024 12:40 or 12:40
error.futureDate: The reminder time should not be in the past
error.limitDate: You cannot create a reminder for a date older than 5 years

edit.newDate: Specify the new time to send the reminder (If not required, specify /skip)
edit.newContent: Specify the new reminder content (If not required, specify /skip)

error.invalidIndex: There is no reminder with this ID
error.invalidDate: Incorrect time format (Format: dd.mm.yyyy hh:mm or hh:mm). For example, on 3.12.2024 12:40 or 12:40
error.futureDate: The reminder time should not be in the past
error.limitDate: You cannot create a reminder for a date older than 5 years

error.invalidIndex: There is no reminder with this ID

ban.replyMessage: Call the command with a response to the message of the user you want to ban
ban.userId: Specify the User Id of the user, or use the /cancel command and call the command again, but with a response to the message of the user you want to block
ban.reason: Specify the reason for the block (If you do not want to specify, enter /skip)
ban.duration: Specify the duration of the lock (If you want an indefinite one, then enter /skip)
ban.complete: The user has been successfully blocked!

unban.replyMessage: Call the command with a response to the message of the user you want to unban

kick.replyMessage: Call the command with a response to the message of the user you want to expel
kick.reason: Specify the reason (If you don't want to specify it, enter /skip)
kick.complete: User @%USERNAME% has been successfully kicked out
kick.completeWithReason: The user @%USERNAME% was successfully kicked out for the reason:ly %REASON%

mute.replyMessage: Call the command with a response to the message of the user you want to entice
mute.reason: Specify the reason (If you don't want to specify it, enter /skip)
mute.duration: Specify the duration of the lock (If you want an indefinite one, then enter /skip)
mute.complete: The user @%USERNAME% has been successfully loaded

unmute.replyMessage: Call the command with a response to the message of the user you want to soften
unmute.reason: Specify the reason (If you don't want to specify it, enter /skip)

warn.replyMessage: Call the command with a response to the message of the user to whom you want to issue a warning
warn.reason: Specify the reason (If you do not want to specify, then enter /skip)
warn.duration: Specify the duration of the warning (If you want an indefinite one, then enter /skip)

error.highPriority: The moderation priority of @%USERNAME% is higher than yours

remWarn.replyMessage: Call the command with a response to the message of the user to whom you want to remove the warning
remWarn.index: Specify the warning index that you want to remove
remWarn.complete: The user @%USERNAME% has successfully cleared the warning #%iINDEX%

error.invalidIndex: A warning with such an identifier does not exist

resetWarns.replyMessage: Call the command with a response to the message of the user to whom you want to remove the warning
resetWarns.confirmUser: Are you sure you want to check the warnings from @%USERNAME%? (yes, no)
resetWarns.confirmAll: Are you sure you want to reset the warnings to all users? (yes, no)
resetWarns.resetUser: All warnings have been reset for @%USERNAME%
resetWarns.resetAll: All warnings have been reset for all users
